reviews.review_text: This was a great game that I looked forward to playing each day. The story (written by Orson Scott Card [Ender's Game]) was compelling and I was looking forward to play the sequels. Unfortunately, they never came.  I played the game years ago (before stats logging). I tried installing it on my Winodws 7 PC, but it didn't quite work so I had to uninstall after only 10 minutes of play. If you have a Windows XP/2000 box give it a shot.

[10/10] Seriously, for a game that came out almost a decade ago It's aged pretty well  Pros: The plot is fantastic Fluent mechanics Combat is really fun Great cast Awesome soundtrack Phenomenal piece overall  Cons: Ending suffers because this is the first of an unreleased triology, leaving you with a (beautiful) cliffhanger Cutscenes are fuzzy (Fixable*)  Conclusion: It's underrated. But the game does so well for itsself it is definitely worth the buy  *To make the cutscenes a bit more polished I recommend looking up 'Advent Revising'. The guy did a fantastic fan patch on polishing this game
highly underrated game.

Epic story. Gameplay and skill developement well ahead of its time. Other than graphics, obviously, it is easily on par with Mass Effect..... dnd then it was shut down before the sequels were done. So sad.

One of my favorite games for the original Xbox. In a lot of ways, it can be seen as a predecessor to Mass Effect: a sci-fi shooter with a deep plot (where decisions made in the first game theoretically would have transferred over to the sequels, had there been any) and some RPG elements (though these are incredibly light RPG elements when compared to those of Mass Effect). It's a bit glitchy at times, but the graphics are pretty good for the era and in no way detract from the experience. Personally, I can't play this without a controller, but I think that's just because that's how I learned it. All in all, a great buy for the price.

Unless I can summon some otherwordly patience within myself to finish this game, I can't recommend it which is a huge shame. I remember hearing about this game when it launched on the Xbox back in the day and when I saw it on Steam, I got excited to try it out after seeing the good reviews.   Unfortunately, I have to disagree with most reviewers. With the understanding that this game is 10 years old, I'm not going to bother talking about the graphics. It's understandable that they're dated and don't hold up well.   The controls are beyond awful and controlling vehicles is a nightmare. The game crashes... a lot. I even installed the Advent Revising fan patch which is supposed to fix a lot of the bugs and crashing issues. Didn't help much. The combat seemed fun at first, but after the 20th encounter with a pack of enemies, you realize that there isn't much in the way of strategy or diversity. Run around, shoot the seemingly endless string of bad guys, repeat. At least the guns are cool.  The game also seems to have a variety of random glitches and errors which I encountered a bunch in my short play time. Some of them are incredibly frustrating and require you to completely restart the level to resolve. Not sure if these problems are prevalent on the console version or if it's a port issue, but it's just one more thing that makes this game a serious test of patience.  The one redeeming quality for me was that the story seemed interesting and well-written. If I do end up finishing this game, it'll be for story alone. That's if I don't go online and just read about it first.  I'd say avoid this game unless you're looking to replay it for nostalgia's sake. It just seems broken in too many ways.

To describe this game you need one word, dissapointing. It is fun game with an interesting story to back it up, but it has problems. From enemies that spawn beside you, enemies that respawn when you walk 5 meters away just to get healed, checkpoints that don't register and of course falling through the level or being blocked by invisible walls. It's such a shame, because the story looked interesting and the combat was really fun.

I've tried to like it, but I can't. Bad control. Bad sound. Bad visuals. Bad interface. Everything seems overyly complicated to do very simple tasks. Keyboard control is touchy. Cannot get joypad controls setup correctly.  I will say that some of you will love this game. I do see this game possibly going far with certain gamers. I'm just not one of them. I took a chance on a Minecrap like game and I just do not like anything about it except for the concept alone. This I do like. Maybe in the future I will try again once it's gotten more updates and changes. But for now I will say I will recommend for serious gamers who love these styles of games, but can't recommend to general public. It's still early with it, so we'll see what happens later. It may change and so will I...

An outstanding but deeply flawed experience. Unique gameplay and a wonderful script are dragged down but not ruined by the mother of all clunky control schemes. Thankfully once throughly rebound (make use of Mouse4 and Mouse5!) the game is very enjoyable. The plot ends on an unfortunate but very well done cliffhanger that will never get it's sequel and the pace of the story is too fast. All that being said, once you get used to the controls fighting becomes great fun, from dual wielding rocket launchers to stealing enemy superguns to things I can't get into without spoilers. It's definitely worth a pickup if you're a fan of space operas, however be prepared to deal with frustrating situations brought on by difficult controls.
